intro: Pseudobaeckea cordata var. monostyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is often found in heathlands or open forests. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with a compact, bushy habit. The variety monostyla is distinguished by its single-stemmed growth pattern, setting it apart from other varieties of Pseudobaeckea cordata.
